channel.title: Resources on Mathematical Michael
channel.description: Recent content in Resources on Mathematical Michael

item.title: Sharing Your Code
item.description: Distributing Projects with PyPy (pip) Unit Testing with Nose Some Nosetests examples BeakerX has a suite of tools for easy reproducibility in the browser

item.title: Writing Resources
item.description: Markdown The comprehensive guide in which I ctrl+F almost everything Someone made a good walkthrough that I often refer to Cheat Sheet from Assemble.io On Writing Jordan B Peterson\’s Guide to Writing an Essay is remarkably helpful when dealing with writers block. Most of the advice generalizes well beyond topics in the humanities.

item.title: Python
item.description: My favorite programming language. Things I Have Written How to set up anaconda - gists.github.com/mpilosov/ String Formatting (making titles out of lowercase strings) Plotting Quick Marginal Distribution Visualization with Seaborn Piecewise-defined functions and 3D Matplotlib Plots Drawing Lines atop scatterplots Plotting a circle Three-Dimensional Projections (with Linear Algebra) Things Others Have Written Learning Pandas (like R… for Python) Scraping Webpages with Pandas Using *args and **kwargs in Python

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Machine Learning is Fun! (a series) Image Classification with Keras Transfer Learning and Image Recognition (repo) A Good Intro to Machine Learning (defunct series but good) Tensorflow Tutorial Tensorflow Models

item.title: General Resources
item.description: My Gists on Github are a good place to see what I have found useful to write down for future reference. The use of sines and cosines in programming (or, how to make pretty pictures!) Git (version control) The guide everyone uses to get started Stop Asking for Password: git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout 28800' git credential-cache exit or, if you’re on OSX: git config --system --unset credential.

item.title: Linux and Bash
item.description: Bash For Loops Digital Ocean has a great writeup to get you started Linux Restarting Networking Setting Up A Secure Ubuntu Server in the Cloud
